title: Early Pandemic Mistakes (with Dave Doogan MP)
itunes:title: Early Pandemic Mistakes (with Dave Doogan MP)
description:
Scotland did not have significantly greater deaths than other parts of the U.K. at the start of the pandemic, Dave Doogan, SNP MP for Angus and the party's spokesperson on Agriculture and Rural Affairs, tells Bloomberg Westminster's Caroline Hepker and Roger Hearing. But Doogan says the Holyrood government did not have the powers to act very differently from Westminster in controlling people's movement as Covid took hold.

In Black History Month, Serlina Boyd, founder of the the U.K.'s first Black children's magazines - 'Cocoa Girl' and 'Cocoa Boy' - discusses the importance of visibility of Black people in society, education and business in increasing diversity and equality.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
content:encoded:
Scotland did not have significantly greater deaths than other parts of the U.K. at the start of the pandemic, Dave Doogan, SNP MP for Angus and the party's spokesperson on Agriculture and Rural Affairs, tells Bloomberg Westminster's Caroline Hepker and Roger Hearing. But Doogan says the Holyrood government did not have the powers to act very differently from Westminster in controlling people's movement as Covid took hold.

In Black History Month, Serlina Boyd, founder of the the U.K.'s first Black children's magazines - 'Cocoa Girl' and 'Cocoa Boy' - discusses the importance of visibility of Black people in society, education and business in increasing diversity and equality.

itunes:author: Bloomberg
